conbody.p: The Text tab allows you to enter textual metadata yout text. It applies only to texts, subtexts and glosses.

ul.li: Secondary Inscription: Select the check box, if your text is a secondary inscription, e.g. if your text is a graffito.

Language: Displays the name of the selected thesaurus entry. This is no input field.
Search Object: You may select the language from the Thesaurus. The Berlin BTS team recommends not to use this field because the language is an intrinsic feature of the text itself and not metadata like other information you annotate in the passport editor.
Open Object in Passport Editor: Displays the passport data of the selected thesaurus entry.
Comment: Add a comment to the language.

Script: Displays the name of the selected thesaurus entry. This is no input field.
Search Object: Select the script from the Thesaurus.
Open Object in Passport Editor: Displays the passport data of the selected thesaurus entry.
Comment: Add a comment to the script.

Texttype: Displays the name of the selected thesaurus entry. This is no input field.
Search Object: Select the texttype from the Thesaurus.
NOTE: A thesaurus is not available at the moment.
Open Object in Passport Editor: Displays the passport data of the selected thesaurus entry.
Comment: Add a comment to the texttype.
